result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikiel D. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. **
Probation & Parole to notify the Court, in Writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mikiel D. Miller

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Mikiel D. Miller. Defendant Mikiel D. Miller in court. Clerk. M.Burke. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Mikiel D. Miller. Defendant Mikiel D. Miller in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Foster is going to be sending a counter offer to the state.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
